lines.content: * The Deadlines class extends the Task class.
* It contains a description, a deadline, and inherits the
* completion status functionality from the Task class.
* Constructs a Deadlines object with the given description and deadline.
* @param description the description of the Deadlines task
* @param deadline the deadline of the Deadlines task
* Returns a string representation of the Deadlines task,
* including its task type indicator, description, and deadline.
* @return a string representation of the Deadlines task
* The Events class extends the Task class.
* It contains a description, start time, end time, and inherits the
* completion status functionality from the Task class.
* Constructs an Events object with the given description, start time, and end time.
* @param description the description of the Events task
* @param start the start time of the Events task
* @param end the end time of the Events task

* Monday is a task management ChatBot. Users can add, mark, unmark,
* delete, keep track of the tasks they have.
* Initialises necessary components, greets the user, handle user input and handle errors.
System.out.println("Index out of Bound Error: " + e.getMessage());
* Parses the user input and performs the corresponding action.
* @param userInput the user input to be parsed
* @return true if the application should continue running, false otherwise
* @throws MondayExceptions if there are errors related to Monday application
* @throws IllegalArgumentException if user input is in the wrong format
private static boolean mondayParser(String userInput) throws MondayExceptions {

System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Prints a farewell message to the console.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");

* The Task class represents a task with a description and a completion status.
* Constructs a Task object with the given description
* and sets its completion status to false.
* @param description the description of the task
* Returns the status icon of the task based on its completion status.
* @return "X" if the task is done, " " (empty space) otherwise
* Marks the task as done by setting its completion status to true.
* Marks the task as not done by setting its completion status to false.
* Returns a string representation of the task,
* including its completion status icon and description.
* @return a string representation of the task
* The Storage class is responsible for storing and managing the tasks in the task list.

* @param task The task to be added.

* @param index The index of the task to be marked as done.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If the index is out of range.
throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException("Task index is out of range. " +
"Check the number of tasks using the 'list' command.");
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n" + taskToEdit);
* Marks a task as not done.
* @param index The index of the task to be marked as not done.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If the index is out of range.
throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException("Task index is out of range. " +
"Check the number of tasks using the 'list' command.");
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n" + taskToEdit);
* Deletes a task from the task list.
* @param index The index of the task to be deleted.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If the index is out of range.
throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException("Task index is out of range. " +
"Check the number of tasks using the 'list' command.");
System.out.println("Noted. I've removed this task:\n" + taskToEdit);
System.out.println("Now you have " + list.size() + " tasks in the list.");
